name: 38bb0775-6ec3-4bf1-8c2e-2426f315c6b2
displayName: Home hospice and payer of last resort

text.text: How do I bill a facility that was neither the origination nor the destination facility?

text: To bill a facility that was neither the origination or destination facility, you can import or create a claim. On the "Coordination of benefits" tab, click "Facility". In the "Primary: Facility" box, you will see three buttons: Origin, Destination, and Other. If your pick-up or drop-off was to a facility, you can pick either to bill.

text.text: Where can I find the option to bill a facility that is neither the origination nor the destination?

text: To bill a facility that was neither the origination or destination facility, you can import or create a claim. On the "Coordination of benefits" tab, click "Facility". In the "Primary: Facility" box, you will see three buttons: Origin, Destination, and Other. If your pick-up or drop-off was to a facility, you can pick either to bill.

text.text: What are the three buttons available in the "Primary: Facility" box?

text: To bill a facility that was neither the origination or destination facility, you can import or create a claim. On the "Coordination of benefits" tab, click "Facility". In the "Primary: Facility" box, you will see three buttons: Origin, Destination, and Other. If your pick-up or drop-off was to a facility, you can pick either to bill. If you don't want to bill either, but want to bill a 3rd party facility, click Other.

text.text: When should I click the "Other" button in the "Primary: Facility" box?

text: You should click the "Other" button in the "Primary: Facility" box if you don't want to bill either the origin or destination facility, but want to bill a 3rd party facility.

text.text: What steps should I take if I want to bill a third-party facility?

text: To bill a third-party facility, you can: Import or create a claim. In the "Primary: Facility" box, click "Other". If you want to bill an existing facility, enter the facility name or address and pick the facility from the list. If you don't find the facility, click "Create a new facility" to add one.

text.text: How do I bill an existing facility as a third-party facility?

text: To bill an existing facility as a third-party facility, you can: Import or create a claim. In the "Primary: Facility" box, click "Other". If you want to bill an existing facility, enter the facility name or address and pick the facility from the list. If you don't find the facility, click "Create a new facility" to add one.

text.text: What should I do if I don't find the facility I want to bill in the list?

text: If you don't find the facility you want to bill in the list, you can click "Create a new facility" to add one.

text.text: Can I add a new facility if the one I need is not in the list?

text: Yes, you can add a new facility if the one you need is not in the list. Adding a new facility can be done by a Company Administrator on the parent level by clicking Facilities on the navigation bar. On the Facilities page, click Add a facility. The name of all child companies that are linked to the parent company displays on the bottom of the New Facility page. By default they are all selected.

text.text: Where do I proceed after selecting or creating the facility I want to bill?

text: After selecting or creating the facility you want to bill, you can click Next to go to the Charges tab.

text.text: What actions should I take on the Charges tab after selecting the facility?

text: You can use the Charges tab to view and change rates. Editing a rate does not affect existing claims. The new rate will be applied to new claims after the change.

text.text: How can I ensure the charges on the claim are accurate before submission?

text: You can use the Charges tab to view and change rates. Editing a rate does not affect existing claims. The new rate will be applied to new claims after the change.

text.text: What should I do if I need to review the claim before submission?

text: The claim's date of service can be changed on the Claim page at any time before the claim is submitted. The "Queue for submission" button displays on the right of the claim header. You can find which batch a particular claim is in by going to the Claim page and clicking the "Audit trail" tab.

text.text: Is there an option to suspend the claim for further review?

text: A claim can be suspended automatically or manually. A claim is placed in a Suspended status anytime: A problem exists on a claim that needs to be resolved, Additional work needs to be done, The claim needs to be verified one last time.

text.text: How do I queue the claim for submission if everything is accurate?

text: To queue a claim for submission, you can click the "Queue for submission" button on the Claim page. The button is located on the right of the claim header. The claim's status will change to "Queued for submission - Clearinghouse".

text.text: What happens after I queue the claim for submission?

text: When a claim is queued for submission, it is scheduled to go to the clearinghouse via the nightly batch submission. If you need to submit the claim to the clearinghouse before that time, click "Submit now" on the Claim page.

text.text: Can I make changes to the claim after queuing it for submission?

text: Yes, you can make changes to the claim after queuing it for submission. To do so, you can click the "edit icon" next to the claim's status and select "Suspended - Hold for Deductible".

text.text: Is there a confirmation message after queuing the claim for submission?

text: If you need to submit the claim to the clearinghouse before the nightly submission, you can click "Submit now" on the Claim page. The system will send the claim to the clearinghouse immediately.

text.text: Where can I find the queued claims for submission?

text: You can find the queued claims for submission on the Waystar Submission page. To start, hover over Claims on the navigation bar and click Waystar Submission.

text.text: Can I track the status of the submitted claims?

text: You can track the status of the submitted claims by using the Billing lifecycle tab. This tab displays all the statuses the claim has gone through including the queued and submitted dates. You can also view the status reasons for claims in each status by clicking the arrow next to the status name.

text.text: What should I do if I encounter any issues during the billing process?

text: The system validates the information on the claim against its billing rules and informs you of any issues that you need to address.

text.text: How to bill a facility that was neither the origination ?

text: To bill a facility that was neither the origination or destination facility, you can follow these steps: 1. Import or create a claim. 2. On the "Coordination of benefits" tab, click Facility. 3. In the "Primary: Facility" box, you see three buttons - Origin, Destination, and Other. 4. If your pick-up or drop-off was to a facility, you can pick either to bill. 5. If you don't want to bill either, but want to bill a 3rd party facility, click Other. 6. If you want to bill an existing facility, enter the facility name or address and pick the facility from the list. 7. If you don't find the facility, click Create a new facility to add one.
